intro: Tricalysia nyassae var. angustifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leafed tricalysia, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical Africa, particularly found in countries like Tanzania and Malawi. The plant is characterized by its slender, elongated leaves that are typically arranged opposite on the stems. It produces small, clustered flowers that are usually white or pale yellow, which bloom during the wet season. This variant is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forests and along riverbanks.
